bibl.title: with an introductory Chapter by J.L. SHARPE III, The Kellis Isocrates Codex (P. Kell. III Gr. 95). (Dakhleh Oasis Project: Monograph No. 5 = Oxbow Monograph 88.)
bibl.note: T. Kellis Gr. III, 95 [faisant suite à: P. Kellis Gr. II, 91-94]. Wooden codex containing 3 orations (Ad Demonicum, Ad Nicoclem, Nicocles) by or attributed to Isocrates, Kellis, between ca. A.D. 325-375. - I. Codicological Observations (J.L.S.). - II. The Discovery, Date and Purpose of the Codex. - III. Analysis of Writing Errors in the Codex. - IV. List of Manuscript and Papyrus Sigla. Excursus: Two Ad Demonicum Papyri Re-united. P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 39879 [ed.: Hermann HARRAUER, Zwei Isokratespapyri, Papiri letterari greci e latini = Papyrologica Lupiensia. 1 (Lecce, 1992) pp. 113-115 et pl. III] + P. Amh. II, 25 (= Pack2 1252). - V. Texts. - VI. The Codex and the Textual Transmission of Isocrates. - VII. A Tabular Comparison of Variant Readings. - VIII. Commentary on Selected Passages. - IX. Hiatus in the Codex. - Appendices. - Bibliography.
